Daley was mildly but publicly critical of Barack Obama 's health care reform strategy. He argued last year: We've really got to listen carefully to the public. Voters are not re-embracing conservative ideology. But we must acknowledge that the left's agenda has not won the support of a majority of Americans- and, based on that recognition, we must steer a more moderate course. Barack Obama has put into place a staff structure that would allow for a shift toward the center-left.
